Package main.java.object

Class SceneObject

java.lang.Object
main.java.object.SceneObject
Direct Known Subclasses:
Plane, Sphere, Triangle
public abstract class SceneObject extends Object
The SceneObject class represents an abstract object in a three-dimensional scene. It defines methods and properties common to all objects in the scene.

  • Constructor Summary

    SceneObject()
    Constructs a new SceneObject with null material.

  • Constructor Details

    • SceneObject

      public SceneObject()
      Constructs a new SceneObject with null material.

  • Method Details

    • intersect

      public abstract boolean intersect(Ray ray, Scene.Intersection intersection)
      Checks if a ray intersects with the scene object and populates the intersection data.
      Parameters:
      ray - The ray to test for intersection.
      intersection - An intersection object to populate with data if an intersection is found.
      Returns:
      true if the ray intersects with the object, false otherwise.

    • getMaterial

      public Material getMaterial()
      Gets the material assigned to the scene object.
      Returns:
      The material of the scene object.

    • setMaterial

      public void setMaterial(Material material)
      Sets the material for the scene object.
      Parameters:
      material - The material to be assigned to the scene object.

    • findIntersectionDistance

      public abstract double findIntersectionDistance(Point p, Vector d)
      Finds the distance to the intersection point between the scene object and a ray defined by a point and direction vector.
      Parameters:
      p - The point of origin for the ray.
      d - The direction vector of the ray.
      Returns:
      The distance to the intersection point, or a suitable value if there is no intersection.
